summary: This is a March 16, 2021 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, transmitting discovery materials. The letter lists a manifest of items seized by the FBI in Florida and New York, designated as confidential under a protective order.

events.title: Discovery Production to Maxwell Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces discovery materials, including manifests of items seized by the FBI, to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, governing the confidentiality of discovery materials.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team on March 16, 2021.
The production included manifests of items seized by the FBI in Florida and New York, designated as confidential.
The materials are governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020.
The document lists five defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell: Christian Everdell, Mark Cohen, Laura Menninger, Jeffrey Pagliuca, and Bobbi Stemheim.
The letter is signed by U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, indicating her office's direct involvement in the prosecution.
